bibl.title: Despatch from William H. Heard to Edwin F. Uhl, February 10, 1896
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: Legation of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, Feby 10, 1896.

p.add: Please look this up-- he seems to have all he wants.
INDEX BUREAU REC'D. MAR 14 1896 DEPT OF STATE

div1.p: William H. Heard, to the Department of State.
Legation of the United States Monrovia, Liberia, Febry 10, 1896.
Hon.Edwin F, Uhl, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington D. C.

Sir: I have the honor in replying to your consular series no. 9 of December 20, 1895 to say, that I gave Hon. Alvey A. Adee Acting Secretary State on Aug. 20 1895 the estimate asked for by you, with exception of better files and pigeon holes, in my Diplomatic series no 17. Hon Richard Olney Secretary of State Authorized me in

his Diplomatic Series 2012 Sept 23 1895. to spend not more than $125.00 for rebuilding Archives- repairing and painting furniture- purchasing desk and chair for office. The work has done, the furniture ordered from New York at a cost of $111.50 not including letter files and pigeon holes. I have drawn draft no 27 in favor of the d'k Grant Monrovia Liberia for the amount.
I am obediently William H. Heard Minister-Res. & Gen.
